intro: Restio wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan restio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which is predominantly found in southern Africa and Australia. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, strap-shaped leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters, typically blooming in the spring. Restio wallichii is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
